info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 1 at 11:02PM EDT until August 2 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1100 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Emergency Manager has reported one eastbound and one westbound lane of Interstate 26 are impassible due to flooding. Additionally, traffic maps indicate numerous other roads are flooded. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Summerville, Goose Creek, Ladson, Sangaree, College Park, Crowfield Plantation, Jedburg, Knightsville and Lincolnville.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY

area.areaDesc: Berkeley, SC; Charleston, SC; Dorchester, SC
